intro: Melanoseris lahulensis, commonly known as the Lahulensis false flax, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a fine layer of silky hairs. It is often found in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
